entity1.name: Deja Vu
entity1.description: A mysterious and fascinating phenomenon that gives a person the feeling of having experienced or seen something before.

entity2.name: scientists
entity2.description: Experts in various fields of science who conduct research to expand knowledge and understanding.

entity3.name: psychologists
entity3.description: Experts in the field of psychology who study human behavior and mental processes.

entity4.name: general public
entity4.description: The broad population or community, not limited to any specific profession or expertise.

entity5.name: deja vu
entity5.description: A term of French origin meaning 'already seen,' which refers to the feeling or sensation that one has experienced a current situation before, even though it is actually happening for the first time.

entity6.name: French
entity6.description: The language of France, from which the term 'deja vu' originates.

entity7.name: deja vu
entity7.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is actually their first time.

entity8.name: deja vu
entity8.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before.

entity9.name: dual processing theory
entity9.description: A hypothesis suggesting that deja vu occurs when the brain processes information in two different ways simultaneously.

entity10.name: deja vu
entity10.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before.

entity11.name: memory-based theory
entity11.description: A theoretical explanation for deja vu, suggesting that it is caused by similarities between the present scenario and a past memory.

entity12.name: brain
entity12.description: The central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing information and controlling bodily functions.

entity13.name: deja vu
entity13.description: A phenomenon where a person has a strong feeling that they have experienced a situation before, despite knowing that it is their first time encountering it.

entity14.name: stress
entity14.description: A state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or demanding circumstances.

entity15.name: fatigue
entity15.description: Extreme tiredness, typically resulting from mental or physical exertion or illness.

entity16.name: sleep deprivation
entity16.description: The condition of not having enough sleep, often leading to impaired cognitive and physiological functions.

entity17.name: deja vu
entity17.description: A phenomenon where a person has a strong feeling that a current event or experience has happened before, despite knowing it is not actually the case.

entity18.name: deja vu
entity18.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is not actually the case.

entity19.name: deja vu
entity19.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed a current situation before, often described as a feeling of familiarity.

entity20.name: deja vu
entity20.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is their first time.

entity21.name: researchers
entity21.description: Individuals who are engaged in systematic investigation to discover and interpret new knowledge or to revise existing knowledge based on the science of deja vu.

entity22.name: general public
entity22.description: The ordinary people, not specifically involved in research, who are interested in and influenced by the phenomenon of deja vu.

entity23.name: deja vu
entity23.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that an event or experience currently being experienced has been experienced in the past.

entity24.name: deja vu
entity24.description: A phenomenon where a person feels that they have experienced or witnessed the current situation before, despite knowing that it is their first time encountering it.

entity25.name: human brain
entity25.description: The central organ of the human nervous system, located in the skull and responsible for controlling most bodily activities.

entity26.name: consciousness
entity26.description: The state of being aware of one's surroundings and thoughts, often studied in philosophy and psychology.

entity27.name: deja vu
entity27.description: A phenomenon where a person has the feeling that an event or experience currently being experienced has been experienced in the past.
